verb.description: Act in an excessively subservient manner.
examples: she didn't have to kowtow to a boss

verb.description: Kneel and touch the ground with the forehead in worship or submission as part of Chinese custom.
synonyms: get down on one's knees before

noun.description: An act of kowtowing as part of Chinese custom.

origin: Early 19th century: from Chinese kētóu, from kē knock + tóu head.
